document_data.name: ''Dancers of Eilistraee''
document_data.author: [[Ondamur Jereth]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dancers of Eilistraee''''' was a ballad penned by the [[minstrel]] named [[Ondamur Jereth]] in the 10{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents:
{{quote|See the dark dancer, through the trees?
'Tis not the goddess herself, but one of her mortal worshippers
Sleek and lithe and shapely, a creature of the night
So beautiful and so deadly
Like black flames—too close and you'll be burned.|Excerpt from ''Dancers of Eilistraee''}}
document_data.History: ''Dancers of Eilistraee'' was first published in a [[chapbook]] in the {{YearlinkName|982}}.
